H0.text: Date of flowering and the fruit yield is the ranking of trees that would most likely be useful in a scientific study of fruit production in apple trees.

H1.text: Fruit yield and taste of the fruit would most likely be useful rankings of trees in a scientific study of fruit production in apple trees.

H2.text: Taste of the fruit and smell of the flower are rankings of trees that would most likely be useful in a scientific study of fruit production in apple trees.

H3.text: Date of flowering and smell of the flower are rankings of trees that would most likely be useful in a scientific study of fruit production in apple trees.

A4.text: Apple trees grafted on dwarfing rootstocks bear about 10–80 kg (20–180 lb) of fruit per year.

A5.text: Group A – Early flowering, 1 to 3 May in England ('Gravenstein', 'Red Astrachan')
